pli-tv-pvr13:1.1: The one who is reproving should be asked by an adjudicator:
pli-tv-pvr13:1.2: “That monk whom you are reproving, reverend sir, for what are you reproving him? Are you reproving him for falling away from moral habit, are you reproving him for falling away from right behaviour, are you reproving him for falling away from right view?”
pli-tv-pvr13:1.4: “I am reproving him for falling away from moral habit, or I am reproving him for falling away from right behaviour, or I am reproving him for falling away from right view,” he should be spoken to thus:
pli-tv-pvr13:1.5: “But does your reverence know … (_see_ Kd.16.11–15 pli-tv-kd16:11.1.1–pli-tv-kd16:15.2.27. _Instead of_ if you suspend this monk’s Invitation _read_ I reprove, you reprove) …
pli-tv-pvr13:1.39: Did you suspect, having heard from disciples of (other) sects?”
pli-tv-pvr13:2.1: If the seen corresponds with the seen,
pli-tv-pvr13:2.2: the seen being in agreement with the seen,
pli-tv-pvr13:2.3: If concerning the seen he does not consent,
pli-tv-pvr13:2.6: may carry out Observance with him.
pli-tv-pvr13:3.1: If the heard corresponds with the heard,
pli-tv-pvr13:3.2: the heard being in agreement with the heard,
pli-tv-pvr13:4.1: If the sensed corresponds with the sensed,
pli-tv-pvr13:4.2: the sensed being in agreement with the sensed,
pli-tv-pvr13:5.1: What is the beginning of reproving, what is in the middle what is the ending?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.2: Giving leave is the beginning of reproving, carrying out is in the middle, a decision is the ending.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.3: How many roots of reproving, how many matters, how many (mental) planes? In how many ways does one reprove?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.4: Two roots of reproving, three matters, five (mental) planes He reproves in two ways.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.5: What are the two roots of reproving?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.7: These are the two roots of reproving.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.8: What are the three matters for reproving?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.9: About the seen the heard, the suspected.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.10: These are the three matters for reproving.
pli-tv-pvr13:5.11: What are the five (mental) planes for reproving?
pli-tv-pvr13:5.12: “I will speak at a right time, not at a wrong time; I will speak about fact, not about what is not fact; I will speak gently, not harshly; I will speak about what is connected with the goal, not about what is not connected with the goal; I will speak with a mind of loving-kindness, not with inner hatred.”
pli-tv-pvr13:5.13: These are the five (mental) planes for reproving.
pli-tv-pvr13:6.1: What are the two ways by which he reproves?
pli-tv-pvr13:6.2: He reproves by body and he reproves by speech.
pli-tv-pvr13:6.3: These are the two ways by which he reproves.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.1: What should be practised by one who is reproving …
pli-tv-pvr13:7.2: by one who is being reproved …
pli-tv-pvr13:7.5: What should be practised by one who is reproving?
pli-tv-pvr13:7.6: Another may be reproved by a reprover who is firm in five things:
pli-tv-pvr13:7.7: “I will speak at a right time, not at a wrong time … I will speak with a mind of loving-kindness, not with inner hatred.”
pli-tv-pvr13:7.8: Thus should it be practised by one who is reproving.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.9: What should be practised by one who is being reproved?
pli-tv-pvr13:7.10: In two things should one who is being reproved practice:
pli-tv-pvr13:7.11: in the truth and in being without anger.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.12: Thus should it be practised by one who is being reproved.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.13: What should be practised by an Order?
pli-tv-pvr13:7.14: What has been said already and what has not been said should be known by an Order.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.15: Thus should it be practised by an Order.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.16: What should be practised by an adjudicator?
pli-tv-pvr13:7.17: As that legal question is settled by an adjudicator according to rule, according to Discipline, according to the Teacher’s Dispensation, so should he settle this legal question.
pli-tv-pvr13:7.18: Thus should it be practised by an adjudicator.
pli-tv-pvr13:8.2: by reason of what is there Invitation,
pli-tv-pvr13:8.4: by reason of what is there sending back to the beginning,
pli-tv-pvr13:8.6: by reason of what is there rehabilitation?
pli-tv-pvr13:9.4: sending back to the beginning is for restraint,
pli-tv-pvr13:10.3: At the breaking up of the body, weak in wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr13:10.5: He goes to Niraya, the stupid fool
pli-tv-pvr13:10.6: who has no reverence for the trainings.
pli-tv-pvr13:11.1: Not depending on things of the world
pli-tv-pvr13:11.4: he should be dealt with according to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr13:12.3: Saying, “It is an offence” he accuses him of what is not an offence:
pli-tv-pvr13:12.4: a reprover such as this burns up himself.
pli-tv-pvr13:13.1: He murmurs in his ear, seeks what is crooked,
pli-tv-pvr13:13.2: passes beyond (the judgement), follows a wrong way—
pli-tv-pvr13:13.3: Saying, “It is an offence” he accuses him of what is not an offence:
pli-tv-pvr13:13.4: a reprover such as this burns up himself.
pli-tv-pvr13:14.1: He reproves at a wrong time, about what is not fact,
pli-tv-pvr13:14.2: harshly, about what is not connected with the goal
pli-tv-pvr13:14.3: he reproves with inner hatred, not with a mind of loving-kindness—
pli-tv-pvr13:14.4: Saying … what is not an offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:15.1: He does not know what is a rule and what not a rule,
pli-tv-pvr13:15.2: he is unskilled in what is a rule and what not a rule—
pli-tv-pvr13:15.3: Saying … what is not an offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:16.1: He does not know what is Discipline and what not Discipline,
pli-tv-pvr13:16.2: he is unskilled in Discipline and what is not Discipline—
pli-tv-pvr13:16.3: Saying … what is not an offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:17.1: He does not know what has been said and what not said …
pli-tv-pvr13:18.1: He does not know what is the usage and what not the usage …
pli-tv-pvr13:19.1: He does not know what has been laid down and what not laid down …
pli-tv-pvr13:20.1: He does not know what is an offence and what not an offence,
pli-tv-pvr13:20.2: he is unskilled in what is an offence and what not an offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:21.1: He does not know a slight offence and a serious offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:22.1: He does not know an offence that can be done away with and one that cannot be done away with …
pli-tv-pvr13:23.1: He does not know what is a very bad and what is not a very bad offence …
pli-tv-pvr13:24.1: He does not know what is the earlier and what the later (talk) …
pli-tv-pvr13:25.1: He does not know the sequence of the connecting words,
pli-tv-pvr13:25.2: he is not skilled in the sequence of the connecting words—
pli-tv-pvr13:25.3: Saying, “It is an offence” he accuses him of what is not an offence:
pli-tv-pvr13:25.4: a reprover such as this burns up himself.

pli-tv-pvr13:28.3: Wrong course: The Teaching is put into the Portion on Reproving.
